In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's an example of how you could define a function `wrap_string` in Julia that takes a string and a maximum width as input, and returns the wrapped text:
```
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    for word in words
        if length(word) + length(wrapped_text) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
        end
        wrapped_text *= word * " "
    end
    return wrapped_text
end
```
This function first splits the input string into individual words using the `split` function. It then iterates over each word in the array, and checks whether the length of the current word plus the length of the wrapped text would exceed the maximum width. If it does, it appends a newline character to the wrapped text before adding the word. Finally, it returns the wrapped text as a string.

For example, if you call `wrap_string("This is a long sentence that needs to be wrapped", 10)`, it will return the following wrapped text:
```
This is a
long sentence
that needs to
be wrapped
```
Note that the default maximum width is set to 10 characters, but this can be changed by passing a different value as the second argument to the `wrap_string` function.
